articles.author: Shristi A, Amruta Khandekar
articles.description: Wall Street's three main indexes rose on Wednesday as U.S. Treasury yields slipped to multi-month lows on growing rate cut optimism, while latest data on economic growth fueled hopes of a soft landing.
articles.title: Wall St gains on rate cut prospects, soft landing hopes

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: The U.S. economy grew faster than initially thought in the third quarter as businesses built more warehouses and accumulated machinery equipment, but momentum appears to have since waned as higher borrowing costs curb hiring and spending.
articles.title: US third-quarter growth revised higher; corporate profits rise strongly

articles.author: David Randall, Lewis Krauskopf, Carolina Mandl
articles.description: Hopes that an economic soft landing will lead the Federal Reserve to pull back on interest rates have ignited Wall Street’s appetite for stocks, despite concerns of slowing growth and the potential of an inflationary rebound in 2024.
articles.title: Rate cut hopes buoy U.S. stocks ahead of uncertain 2024

articles.author: Martin Coulter
articles.description: Google DeepMind has used artificial intelligence (AI) to predict the structure of more than 2 million new materials, a breakthrough it said could soon be used to improve real-world technologies.
articles.title: Google DeepMind AI reveals potential for thousands of new materials

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: General Motors (GM.N) said on Wednesday it will buy back $10 billion in shares and boost its dividend by 33%, even as it cuts spending at its troubled robotaxi unit Cruise and lowered profit expectations following the lengthy auto workers' strike.
articles.title: GM to buy back $10 billion in shares, cut Cruise spending

articles.author: Andrew Chung, John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court is poised on Wednesday to consider the legality of the Securities and Exchange Commission's in-house proceedings to enforce investor-protection laws and impose penalties in a case that could broadly undercut the power of federal agencies.
articles.title: US Supreme Court weighs legality of SEC in-house enforcement

articles.author: Chibuike Oguh
articles.description: Shares of German sandal maker Birkenstock (BIRK.N) extended their gains on Wednesday, hitting the initial public offering price for the first time, following a buoyant holiday shopping season.
articles.title: Birkenstock shares extend rally, hit IPO price for first time

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammemd Salem, Henriette Chacar
articles.description: Hamas and Israel were expected to release more hostages and prisoners on Wednesday, the last day of a prolonged six-day truce in the Gaza Strip conflict, as attention focused on whether mediator Qatar could negotiate another extension.
articles.title: Israel, Hamas due to release more people amid efforts to extend truce

articles.author: James Oliphant, Alexandra Ulmer
articles.description: Nikki Haley is having a moment: The 2024 Republican presidential candidate is seeing a swell in media coverage, new interest from big-dollar donors and increasing chatter that she is poised to make a real run at Donald Trump.
articles.title: Nikki Haley's getting buzz, but faces tough math to beat Trump

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: The United States has charged an Indian national with conspiring to assassinate a U.S. citizen who advocated for a sovereign state for Sikhs, the U.S. attorney's office in Manhattan said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US charges Indian national with conspiracy to assassinate Sikh separatist
